data.question: What is the chemical formula of the homochiral porous metal-organic framework mentioned?
What is the enantiomeric excess (ee) percentage achieved for the addition of diethylzinc to 1-naphthaldehyde using the catalyst derived from the MOF?
How does the size of dendritic aldehydes affect the yield of ZnEt2 addition products catalyzed by 1·Ti?
data.answer: As the size of the dendritic aldehyde increases, the yield of the ZnEt2 addition product steadily decreases.

data.question: Is the catalytic system involving the MOF and Ti(OiPr)4 for the addition of ZnEt2 to aromatic aldehydes heterogeneous?
What is the specific surface area of the evacuated sample of the MOF?
Does the framework structure of the MOF remain intact upon the removal of all solvent molecules?
What is the role of the chiral dihydroxy groups in the MOF?
data.answer: They are used to generate Lewis acidic (BINOLate)Ti(OiPr)2 compounds which are active catalysts for the addition of ZnEt2 to aromatic aldehydes.

data.question: Was the MOF able to catalyze the addition of ZnEt2 to aromatic aldehydes with complete conversion for all tested aldehydes?
What is the crystal system and space group of the MOF?
Did the MOF-derived catalyst show higher enantioselectivity compared to homogeneous analogues in diethylzinc addition reactions?
What is the maximum enantiomeric excess (ee) percentage reported for the addition of ZnEt2 to aromatic aldehydes using the MOF-derived catalyst?
Is the catalytic activity of the MOF-derived system affected by the size of the aromatic aldehyde?
What is the void space percentage in the MOF?
Can the MOF be used for heterogeneous asymmetric catalysis?
What is the role of Ti(OiPr)4 in the catalytic process involving the MOF?
data.answer: It reacts with the chiral dihydroxy groups in BINOL or its analogues to afford active catalysts for the addition of ZnEt2 to aromatic aldehydes.

data.question: Does the MOF contain large chiral channels?
What is the cross-section size of the large chiral channels in the MOF?
Are the catalytic sites in the MOF accessible via the large open channels?
What is the primary functionality of the axially chiral bridging ligand used in the MOF?
Is the MOF constructed from axially chiral bipyridine bridging ligands?
